org.jdesktop.swingx.table.renderers
Class EditRenderer

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLabel
                  javax.swing.table.DefaultTableCellRenderer
                      org.jdesktop.swingx.table.renderers.EditRenderer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants, javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer
public class EditRenderer
extends javax.swing.table.DefaultTableCellRenderer

This subclass of the DefaultTableCellRenderer is used to distinguish between editable and non-editable cells. It leaves editable cells alone, but slightly darkens cells that are read-only. All the work is done by a public static method, so this Renderer may be used directly, or the static method may be called from any other Cell Renderer.

Author:
Miguel Muñoz
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getTableCellRendererComponent

public java.awt.Component getTableCellRendererComponent(javax.swing.JTable table,
                                                        java.lang.Object value,
                                                        boolean isSelected,
                                                        boolean hasFocus,
                                                        int row,
                                                        int column)
Returns the default table cell renderer. Delegates the work to the static shadeReadOnly() method. Other renderers may do the same thing by calling the shadeReadOnly()

Specified by:
getTableCellRendererComponent in interface javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer
Overrides:
getTableCellRendererComponent in class javax.swing.table.DefaultTableCellRenderer
Parameters:
table - the JTable
value - the value to assign to the cell at [row, column]
isSelected - true if cell is selected
hasFocus - true if cell has focus
row - the row of the cell to render
column - the column of the cell to render
Returns:
the default table cell renderer

shadeReadOnly

public static void shadeReadOnly(java.awt.Component cmp,
                                 javax.swing.JTable table,
                                 int row,
                                 int column,
                                 boolean isSelected)
Makes non-editable cells draw slightly darker than editable cells. This may be called from any table cell renderer. If the renderer extends from DefaultTableCellRenderer, call this after the call to the super method.

The parameters match those in the getTableCellRendererComponent().

Parameters:
cmp - The renderer component.
table - The JTable
row - The row index
column - The column index
isSelected - The selected state of the cell.
See Also:
getTableCellRendererComponent(javax.swing.JTable,java.lang.Object,boolean,boolean,int,int)
